medical_history.chief_complaint: RLQ pain and BRBPR (bright red blood per rectum)
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: RLQ abdominal pain started suddenly and was sharp. No radiation. Lying down improves pain, worse with sitting up. Pain worsened when the patient tried to have a bowel movement, with one small BM last night causing reddish blood mixed in with stool. The patient reported loose bowel movements but no diarrhea. Positive nausea and vomited once.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Stage IA (T1N0) NSCLC, paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, mild pulmonary hypertension, elevated liver function tests of unknown etiology, osteoporosis, hypertension.
medical_history.family_history: Mother passed at age ___ and may have had hypertension. Father passed at age ___ with colon cancer. Sister has multiple health issues including possible chronic fatigue syndrome.
